title: 106_hr773
content: SECTION 1. TECHNICAL AMENDMENTS. Several provisions of the Older Americans Act of 1995 are amended, including the removal of certain sections and the redesignation of others. Additionally, name changes are made within the Act. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended, including the removal and redesignation of sections, as well as name changes within the Act, such as replacing "Labor and Human Resources" with "Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions." The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended, including changes in sections and names within the Act. SEC. 2 authorizes appropriations. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for various programs, including the Federal Council on Aging, Administration, and Grants for State and Community Programs on Aging for fiscal years 2000 through 2002. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for programs for fiscal years 2000 through 2002. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for programs for fiscal years 2000 through 2002, including changes in specific funding amounts for various subsections. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for programs for fiscal years 2000 through 2002, including changes in specific funding amounts for various subsections such as availability of surplus commodities and training, research, and discretionary projects and programs. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for programs for fiscal years 2000 through 2002, including changes in specific funding amounts for various subsections such as community service employment for older Americans and grants for Native Americans. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for programs for fiscal years 2000 through 2002, including changes in specific funding amounts for various subsections such as vulnerable elder rights protection activities. The Older Americans Act of 1995 is amended to adjust funding levels for programs for fiscal years 2000 through 2002, including changes in specific funding amounts for various subsections such as Native American programs. SEC. 3. TRANSFERS. Section 308(b) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to adjust funding percentages for fiscal years and allocate an additional 10 percent of funds received for the fiscal year. Section 308(b) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to adjust funding percentages for fiscal years and allocate an additional 10 percent of funds received for the fiscal year. In subparagraph (B), the text is revised to simplify the language and remove specific references to fiscal year 1996.
